messages.title: A message from Rebecca Fraser
messages.content: The general election on 12th December will be an opportunity for local people in Midlothian to elect a Member of Parliament who is guaranteed to stand up to Nicola Sturgeon and work to take Scotland out of our United Kingdom. At the last election, the Scottish Conservative vote in Midlothian increased by more than 13% while the SNP dropped by 16%. It’s closer. No matter who you usually vote for, a vote for the Scottish Conservatives this time is the only way to send the SNP a message they can’t ignore. Nicola Sturgeon wants to hold another independence referendum next year – your vote can stop her. Again and again, Nicola Sturgeon has been told we don’t want another referendum, but she just won’t listen. If the SNP win here in Midlothian, Nicola Sturgeon will have another mandate for her referendum. And if Jeremy Corbyn is Prime Minister, he has said he would not stop a second referendum. This election is our chance to get the Scottish Conservatives can stop Nicola Sturgeon’s independence referendum. The stakes really could not be higher. A win for the SNP in Midlothian is another mandate for her referendum next year.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Send the SNP a clear message - No second independence referendum.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for anyone but Rebecca Fraser – or not voting at all – risks helping Nicola Sturgeon.

community.content: Local people in Midlothian have voted to stop SNP’s independence referendum.

leaflet.personalStatement: I know that at the last general election many people here in Midlothian who had never voted Scottish Conservative before lent us their vote. All the indications are that the result this time is going to be very close, so even if you don’t always vote Scottish Conservative, lend me your vote on this occasion to beat the SNP.

quotes.text: A vote for anyone but Rebecca Fraser – or not voting at all – risks helping Nicola Sturgeon.
